ai.summary: Dog Rose Ramble is a 14.9 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom, following rural lanes and hedgerow lined fields. The route offers wildlife and countryside scenery, with seasonal wildflowers such as dog rose. Be prepared for muddy sections after rain and gentle gradients rather than steep climbs.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly rural footpaths and country lanes with some compact gravel, muddy field edges, stiles, and occasional gates. Expect hedgerows, small climbs, and uneven surfaces; waterproof footwear is advised.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for changing weather in the UK. Wear sturdy boots and bring waterproof layers. Stay on marked paths, mind gates and stiles, and keep dogs under control. Carry water, snacks, a basic first aid kit, a map or GPS, and a phone with offline maps. Check daylight hours and be prepared for mud, farm traffic, and limited mobile signal in remote sections.
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight if there is a chance of finishing after dark
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn offers the best conditions and hedgerow blooms; the route is walkable year round but winter can be muddy and daylight is shorter.
